title: Yasuo should have been an energy champ
body:
No it would not kill him if he was balanced for it but it would make there be limits to how much he can move around between minions before no longer having a wind wall open to him.

That is generally one of the biggest frustrations with him. He lacks any major periods where he is really vulnerable because of his actions.

EDIT: Did I mention he is Ionian? Yes this matters since only Ionians can use energy due to an unwritten rule.

Actually, Morgana fails against someone who knows how to shove lane. She can't get many ticks off on her puddle, because the wave is constantly getting shoved to the turret. A well played Yasuo will make that lane hell for Morgana, and he should end the lane with a CS and level advantage. Granted, it's hard for Yasuo to actually kill her, but he doesn't need to in order to win that lane.

i'm akali main, and i've been playing lots of blind pick where i cant get mid (well i just fill, wait for everyone to choose their champs then i choose mine)

Well try facing against him as brand. After lv 3 (sometimes 2) it's pretty crp against any Yasuo worth his salt. Windwall? There goes your only CC and your ult. The DoT still pops his shield which is nice, but it's BS how effective his windwall is. Kassadin should have that kinda stuff as an antimage with a genuinely weak laning phase, AND mana issues.

And even then... nobody should have Windwall as it currently exists. I wouldn't mind if it weakened projectiles but let them pass (because wind can totally stop arcane missiles and bullets that effortlessly slice through the air, right?) in its weakened state, but completely invalidating them is just awful.

Correct me if I'm wrong, but wouldn't the only spell Lux has that gets blocked by Yasuo be the snare? Which, by the way, has a cooldown nearly twice the length?  Lux's spells are also more forgiving on the landing, as they deal uniform damage no matter where they land, as well as her being overall much more safe then Xerath.

Trust me, if I'm playing against a really good Yasuo (I.E., better then me), then it hurts. Badly. But that's not Yasuo, that's the player's experience, same as if I went against an incompetent Yasuo as Xerath (it's hilarious btw, they keep trying to windwall your Q).

If your complaint is that Yasuo counters champions he is designed to counter well, then you don't have an argument.

Well then you don't throw out your entire combo when he has his shield!

Any Yasuo worth his salt will max windwall last, so up until level 14, it has a cooldown of 26 seconds. The only ability Lux has that gets close to that is her ult, and when you add in the fact that you are going to have CDR and he isn't, your abilities are on a much lower cooldown then the wall. So what you do is you poke him down (he can't windwall everything), and when you get him low enough, you bait out the wall, then when your spell is up again (and his still needs half the cooldown), you burst him.

If that isn't enough, add in "call jungler for gank" before the bait out the wall step. Have them come from the side (from the back and Yas can dash through him), so that Yas is forced to deal with blocking either your damage and CC, or the junglers.
